results.title: Man on the moon: epic journey of Apollo 11
results.creator_credit: Columbia Broadcasting System, Philip Scheffler and Joel Banow
results.brief_description: A report of the Apollo 11 mission to the Moon. Follows the progress of the various phases of the flight, including the landing of the lunar module, the first Moon walk by Neil Armstrong and Edwin Aldrin, and return to earth and splashdown in the Pacific.

results.title: Man on the moon: Apollo 11 [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and National Aeronautics and Space Administration
results.brief_description: Shows the details of the lunar surface from official footage recorded by the Apollo 11 spacecrew during the first manned moon landing on 20th July, 1969. Part of the 2 million feet of film made Public Domain by NASA. Silent film with English subtitles.

results.title: Man on the moon [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Mutual Film Company, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher and Milos Forman
results.brief_description: Jim Carrey won accolades for his performance as real life comedian Andy Kaufman in this bio-pic directed by Milos Foreman (One who flew over the cuckoos nest, Amadeus, The People vs. Larry Flint). With a brand of humour bordering on the profane, Kaufman measured the success of routines by the degree of offence taken by the audience. The film plots Kaufman’s rise through the stand-up ranks, until he graduated to television roles, the most famous of which was on the US TV comedy show “Taxi”. Danny de Vito plays George Shapiro, Kaufman’s manager who identified him as a true talent (perhaps even a genius) where others saw him as an annoying imbecile. The film tracks Kaufman’s romance to Lynne Margulies (Courtney Love), the trials faced by increasing fame and his need to continuously push the boundaries of acceptable material. Kaufman would often perform routines under an alias unbeknownst to those around him, including other cast and crew members. Foreman avoids delving into the motivations or psychology behind Kaufman’s peculiar artistic expression, opting instead for detailed reproductions of Kaufman’s many routines and characterisations.

results.title: Man of wheat: the saga of Glen Miller
results.brief_description: A study of Glen Miller, an ex-school teacher who went into farming in America in 1942, and who has since built up a huge acreage, coupled with a high level of capital invesment. His sons and grandsons help run the farm as well as maintain the huge and expensive machinery that lies idle all year round, except for the five weeks of harvesting when it is put to work seven days a week, eighteen hours a day. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Man of tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Army Kinema Corporation, Ronald H. Riley and David H. Villiers
results.brief_description: Army training in leadership, given mainly at an “Outward Bound” school, where the emphasis is on character building rather than on traditional military training. The stories, humorously told, of a group of boys drawn from all Corps of the Army, who are seen following the various pursuits which fit them for leadership in Army careers.

results.title: Man of marble = Czlowiek z marmuru [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Film Polski, Zespol Filmowy 'X' and Andrzej Wajda
results.brief_description: Lauded a national hero in the 1950s due to his skills at his trade, Mateusz Birkut has fallen into the shadows. In making a film of the bricklayer’s life, documentary director Krystyna Janda discovers that he used his fame to become involved in politics - resulting in the government wiping out all traces of his accomplishments. Excised by the Polish censors when first released, ‘Man of marble’ uses reconstructions of old black and white newsreels and matches the stylistic tenets of the documentary genre. (Awards: Winner of the FIPRESCI award, Cannes Film Festival, 1978). In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Man of letters (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Professor Dorton Serry, played by Warren Mitchell, is a Man of letters. An esteemed philosopher and lover of all women, he controls his world absolutely. So how does he react when the women in his life step out of their allotted roles and challenge his prejudices and philosophy of life? Adapted from the novel by Glen Tomasetti.
